assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: PD involves dopaminergic neuron loss and Lewy bodies with α-synuclein aggregation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Aggregation is central to PD pathology.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of assay classes
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: In vitro aggregation studies model the disease mechanism.

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: A53T promotes α-synuclein aggregation, indicating pathogenicity with supporting evidence.

assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: In vitro assays model the mechanism.

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: A30P promotes α-synuclein aggregation, indicating pathogenicity with supporting evidence.

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: E46K promotes α-synuclein aggregation, indicating pathogenicity with supporting evidence.
